trans:
1 egg
20 g butter at room temperature
10 g salt (1 teaspoon)
For the sauce
1 head of garlic (It was difficult to cook in the casserole, you can first wrap it in baking paper and then in aluminum foil and cook it at 200 degrees for about 15 minutes, but make sure the oven is preheated, wait until it cools down at the end of the time so that it softens completely)
Thyme, olive oil, salt (pour over the garlic and put it in the oven)
70 g butter, parsley
100 g kashar cheese
Let the butter be at room temperature, crush the garlic, chop the parsley finely, mix everything and the sauce is readyğŸ˜Œ
Preparation
Put the flour in a mixing bowl, make a hole in the middle, add the yeast, granulated sugar, warm milk and wait for the yeast to activate (about 5 minutes) add the necessary ingredients except butter (including the slurry) knead the dough until it is smooth, finally add the butter and knead it one last time (The consistency of your dough may vary depending on its quality, it will be a medium hard dough) put the dough to ferment, after the time has passed, after removing the air, roll it out into a square shape 30*30 (I measured it for youğŸ¥°ğŸ˜€) spread your garlic sauce oil on the dough, add grated kashar cheese on top and divide it into 16 equal pieces, put them on top of each other and put it in the baking dish, leave it to ferment (about 30 minutes) at the end of the time, spray water on the dough, add kashar cheese in between the dough Bake it on the lowest shelf of a fan oven that has not been preheated to 180 degrees until it is completely browned, done ğŸ™‚
